data.title: One of my favorites
data.text:
Great place, one of my favorites as a Cedar Park local. I love the cheese they bring to your table with meat and light it on fire to melt the cheese. The Carona-rita's are really good. The prices are great and they sometimes have a mariachi band.
It's a must try Mexican restaurant.

data.title: Good food and Mariachis = fun dinner out
data.text:
My wife and I took a friend out for dinner to celebrate her birthday.  She had specifically asked for us to take her to Los Chilaquiles on a Thursday night because they have Mariachis.  When the 3 of us arrived, we were seated immediately.  The mariachis were there and started playing soon after we got our menus.  
So, looking at the menu, there was a good selection of standard items you'd find in a Mexican restaurant.  Our friend ordered enchiladas, I got a super burrito covered in enchilada sauce and cheese (reminiscent of a recent dinner at Cafe Rio in Phoenix - though the burrito was simpler here) and my wife got the pechuga mexicana which was a grilled chicken breast with bacon and other trimmings, rice and beans.  We all enjoyed our food, the waitress was busy, but fairly attentive and everything went smoothly.  I signaled the mariachis and we paid for 4 songs between us at $10 each, which was fairly reasonable as there were 5 guys.  Two on trumpet, one on a base, one on a violin and I believe one regular guitar.  They played a good selection of different popular mariachi songs.  We had Las Man~anitas for the birthday girl, and Mi Linda Esposa for my wife.  The place seems pretty popular - at least on a Thursday after 7pm when the mariachis are present.  It was completely full and there were people waiting for tables.  As I looked around, everyone seemed to be having fun, enjoying the music, and many were drinking margaritas or beers.  We just had water.  I would recommend it - particularly when the mariachis are there.  You can enjoy them without paying anything - unless you want them to sing at your table.  They are pretty loud and limit conversation when they are nearby.

data.title: Beautiful Tex-Mex Restaurant with Great Foo..
data.text: Best Lunch Specials, great service, and wonderful Tex-Mex favorites. I particularly liked the chicken fajita tacos.

data.title: Love their margueritas.  Especially the sangria flavored.
data.text: Popular neighborhood mexican restaurant in a strip center.  Inside family friendly decor and good food.

data.title: Excellent service with our waitress...food was wonderful!
data.text: Great experience and I will return.  Our waitress was so busy, but she took excellent care of us.  The food was super!!!!

data.title: OK for takeout
data.text: We stopped for a quick lunch and found the meal satisfactory but not exceptional.  The entrees are somewhat overpriced.

data.title: BEST Chilaquiles
data.text: I have had almost all Chilaquiles there and not one disappointed.  Their salsa is quite yummy too and their margs do not disappoint

data.title: Very loud but fun place
data.text: We were there in Friday evening. The place had life music and good food. But it's pretty loud. There are also a lot of families with kids. In general very nice place. I recommend it.

data.title: Great food, good service, good price point
data.text:
We came right around noon and got seated pretty much right away. The food was excellent and and the service was pretty good, but honestly, could have been a little better. The main issue was the server seemed a little inattentive. With that being said, it did seem like they were a little short staffed so that could have been the reason, so I don't completely fault her. Plus, when she did come by, she was great and got all our orders right.

The chips and salsa were fresh and on point. The flaming queso appetizer was really good with Chorizo and the fact that they set it on fire was pretty cool. The food came out promptly and was timed well after the delivery of the appetizer. Everything was hot and fresh. No complaints there. I highly recommend this place.

data.title: Gone downhill a bit
data.text: I gave Los Chilaquiles a great review quite awhile back.  Unfortunately the food just isn't up to those same high standards.  As of now I can only give it an average rating.  The food is okay, but nothing special.  The best thing is the margarona.

data.title: Just plain good!
data.text: We always get the queso flamba appetizer...sooo good and kinda fun! Neat presentation, including fire! The margaritas are good and generous. Employees are gracious and knowledgeable about the menu.

data.title: The best mexican restaurant in Austin
data.text: There's a reason why this place is called Chilaquiles they have THE best ones in Austin not only that but the drinks are awesome and beautiful looking the food is great tasting and big portioned anything you pick out of the menu is great and the service is fast and friendly great place to go with friends and family, one of my favorite restaurants in Austin

data.title: Great food.
data.text: I love the food here. The atmosphere can be a little boisterous & noisy depending on the evening. The service is hit & miss at best, that depends on whether or not they are busy. However, the food is always good. The 1st time I went here as soon as the chips and salsa hit the table I knew I would be happy with the meal & was not disappointed.

data.title: Continues to amaze!
data.text: I've visited this restaurant several times, whenever I'm in the neighborhood and always find it enjoyable.  I usually have the Taco Salad and love the freshness of the ingredients.  Last time, my granddaughter was with me and ordered a burger and seasoned fries.  I tried some of the fries and they were delicious and I told her so.  She responded, "the burger is even better!"  Service is good and the staff are friendly, with smiling faces that says a lot about how they enjoy their job.  The decor is colorful.  This is a happy place!

data.title: They Took Away my Bad Review
data.text: I had a bad review because they skipped my name on the wait list and then they lied about it.  They threatened to call the police because they said I had a bad attitude when I complained.  The food is good though.

data.title: Great food and great atmosphere
data.text: I am now a regular here. Live music every Tuesday (mexican/latin pop) or Thursday (mariachis). Atmosphere and service is always great! On top of that, food is outstanding. Good portions and value. I am hispanic, picky with Tex Mex and mexican food, this one gets my vote as one of best in Austin!

data.title: Large Portions, Good Service
data.text: This place is always busy but we've never had to wait to be seated and served. Homemade chips and salsa served warm are immediately brought to the table. The chicken enchilada plate is my favorite. Each one has at least a quarter pound of well seasoned white meat. The green sauce adds to the flavor but is mild enough not to mask the chicken. If you are in north Austin or Cedar Park, Texas, this would be a nice choice for family, friends or business. Full bar with good house margaritas at a reasonable price.

data.title: We didn't care for it
data.text: My husband and I didn't care for this eatery. The margaritas seemed to be made from a mix and there was nothing remarkable about the food

data.title: Good Cedar Park TexMex
data.text: This restaurant is tucked into a strip center along 183 next to the Ace Hardware. I don't live real close to it's location but I often eat here when I find myself along South Bell Blvd at mealtimes. There are several small,strip center Mexican Restaurants in this particular area of Cedar Park but Los Chilaquiles is the best of them in service, decor and menu! A great place for a sit down lunch or a casual dinner where the food is good, the service quick and the prices reasonable.

data.title: Different than typical and very tasty Mexican food
data.text:
I come here regularly with my family.  The restaurant is casual and inviting.  Service is friendly and efficient.  The menu is diverse and has many items not typical in most other Mexican or Tex-mex restaurants in the area.
I recommend the margaritas, especially the margarona which is a frozen margarita with a coronita beer stuck in upside-down.  It may sound strange (I've seen it elsewhere as well though) but it is fantastic.  
For the food I've liked everything that I've tried.  The special fajitas with the cactus is recommended.
